availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Warren Erwin (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Green County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Wallace Erwin. Father of Mary Erwin, Milton Irwin, John Irwin, Elizabeth Irwin, Jane Irwin, Malinda Irwin, Robert Irwin, and Ada A. Erwin. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Served in the 30th Indiana Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 24, 1862, to October 21, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 93A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 582.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Precinct 3, p. 477B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Grant County Births.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Indiana, vol. 5 (Indianapolis: Samuel M. Douglass, 1866), 18.
